alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 08 at 3:04PM AKST until January 10 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected ranging 40 below zero to 50 below zero. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Deltana and Tanana Flats southeast of Salcha. * WHEN...Now through 3 AM Monday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East winds will remain gusty through Sunday. This will cause very cold wind chills at times through late Sunday. Blowing and drifting snow will occur as well. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.
